paper_title: Platinum single-atoms anchored covalent triazine framework for efficient photoreduction of CO2 to CH4

catalyst.source: Herein, we report a well-defined positioned synthesis of Pt single atoms in ethylene glycol (EG)-modified covalent triazine framework (Pt-SA/CTF-1) via a photo-deposition method for efficient photoreduction CO 2 to CH 4 under visible light irradiation.
catalyst.context: Achieving maximum atom-utilization efficiency is desirable to facilitate the charge separation and CO 2 activation for photocatalytic CO 2 reduction.Herein, we report a well-defined positioned synthesis of Pt single atoms in ethylene glycol (EG)-modified covalent triazine framework (Pt-SA/CTF-1) via a photo-deposition method for efficient photoreduction CO 2 to CH 4 under visible light irradiation.The well-defined coordination structure of Pt-N(C) sites in the Pt-SA/CTF-1 catalyst has been probed by HAADF-STEM and EXAFS.Results show that Pt single atoms confined into CTF-1 not only improved CO 2 adsorption and activation but also accelerated the separation and transfer of photogenerated carriers in CTF-1.Consequently, Pt-SA/CTF-1 exhibited superior photoactivity and stability, which significantly surpass the Pt nanoparticles-based CTF-1, affording CH 4 as the main reduction product.This work showcases an operable avenue to develop single-metal-atom photocatalysts and a mechanistic insight into photoreduction of CO 2 by CTF-based composite.

A homogeneous suspension of CTF-1 (500 mg) in EG (30 mL) was transferred into a 50 mL Teflon-lined stainless-steel autoclave and then heated at 150 C for 4 h, After natural cooling, the solid was separated and washed with copious amount of ultrapure water and ethanol, and vacuum-dried at 60 C overnight to afford CTF-EG as gray solid, The as-prepared CTF-EG (50 mg) was then dispersed in ultrapure water (30 mL) under stirring.25 L H 2 PtCl 6 solution (1 mg/mL) was dropped into the obtained suspended solution.After bubbling of nitrogen gas for 30 min, the obtained suspension was subjected to irradiation by ultraviolet lamps for 30 min, where the EG was consumed as a sacrificial agent to facilitate the removal of Cl -ligands on Pt, thus enabling the stabilization of Pt single atoms by forming Pt-N bonds and anchoring on CTF-1 61.The obtained solid then underwent washing with ultrapure water and ethanol, and thereafter naturally dried.
